pros: My manager is nice, team is good. Some consumers are kind
cons: Consumers and family verbally abuse you with no consequences. Racism and sexism along with sexual harassment by consumers is accepted at MVES. You cannot support yourself in this area on the income. Upper Management could care less about you

review_title: Was good company but very stressful with staff shortage
job_title: Health Services Care Manager in Malden, MA
pros: Manu supervisors are helpful. Colleagues are great and helpful. Hybrid work schedule. 4 day schedule available, getting paid for 35 hours in addition must take unpaid 1/2 hour lunch. Many clients are great.
cons: Done covid, it had gotten stressful and not getting better. Short staffed is ongoing so whoever is on call for the day is completely overworked. Clients get angry because it's so hard finding workers to come to home and care for them. Stressful and overworked and it's not improving. Am have to meet all metrics even though you have so much more work. Working thru lunch and pass your hours have been more typical past year and not being better. If not, then you won't meet metrics. Sad, when I started 4 years ago, it wasn't like this and really enjoyed the work. Still like the the work of helping families of everything else wasn't so overwhelming.

job_title: Case Manager Gssc in Malden, MA
pros: Flexible schedule, great team work and benefits
cons: Work can be stressful with high caseloads

job_title: Health Services Care Manager in Malden, MA
pros:
Love helping elderly families and making a difference in their lives.
Great teamwork and support from managers and colleagues.
Most are friendly and helpful. Opportunities for promotion.
Option to work 4 days/week instead of 5 is great since most of us also work a second job.
cons: The amount you are expected to do can be overwhelming and stressful. The basic work that's due each month plus all the daily surprises that come in. Many have left which makes it more difficult to be during your weekly (sometimes it's 2x week) on-call shift, you don't have any time to get to your own because you are answering calls and solving issues for coworkers who have left the company.

job_title: Geriatric Support Services Coordinator in Malden, MA
pros: I worked at MVES for one year as a GSSC for the SCO department and for the most part, it was a good job with decent pay, good benefits, good flexibility for work hours. My favorite thing here is the choice for 4 day work weeks and the ability to schedule out your day for home visits and documentation as you please. The coworkers are great and the supervisors are ok, some are better than others.
cons: Overworked at times. Deadlines that at times come up out of nowhere. Management is not always supportive if a problem arises. They try to be but in the end they only care about deadlines.

cons:

Pay is not good for the work you do

pros: Teammates and managers help to bring it all together,4 day work week and benefits
cons: Pay is way too low and high caseloads

pros: good family life balance great company
cons: low wage for a decent amount of work

pros: It's 35 hours a week with the option of a 4 or 5 day work week. One of the biggest perks is the benefits (health, dental, paid holidays, vacation, sick and personal time). Pre-pandemic, we were able to work remotely twice a week. I've have and had great managers. Working with this community is great too.
cons: Low pay, sometimes difficult consumers

job_title: Case Manager Gssc in Medford, MA
pros: Flexible time off and Great people
cons: Can’t really grow and low pay

review_title: SO many great benefits at this company!
pros: Case management in itself is a challenging job, but this place honestly cares about both the clients AND employees. The benefits are awesome- you get a 4 day work week (36 hrs), paid holidays, gas reimbursement,vacation time, sick time, and personal time. You have to do around 20-30 home visits a month, and an on call shift once or twice a week. Most case managers have been there between 5-25 years because it is such a great company. There is always a supervisor around to help. There is great training when you first start, and there are always additional trainings offered most months. There is room to grow in the company and to get promotions/raises. Upper management knows mostly everyone by name and are easy to talk to.
cons: The pay.. but that is pretty common in the human services field.

review_title: What an awesome place to work!
pros: Mystic Valley staff live the mission of helping low income elders and adults living with disabilities remain safely at home for as long as possible. In addition to demonstrating care and concern for their clients, managers demonstrate the same for staff.  The benefits are awesome and I'm able to work a 4-day week that saves me paying for 1 day of daycare.  My supervisor is professional and supportive.   When I need help my supervisor, or another supervisor,  is always available.  I have the flexibility of scheduling my work for each day, and am able to work independently at my pace.  The work I do is very rewarding and I'm proud to be connected to MVES.
cons: Salaries are a little low.

job_title: Health Services Case Manager in Somerville, MA
pros: This is my 2nd job out of school and it is a great place to learn.  I have been here for a little less than a year and feel that there is a lot to learn and the managers are helpful and supportive.  The company is growing and there are a lot of new hires; more are hired than leave so you can see the growth.  There is opportunity to move into different types of case management positions and I can apply for open jobs even though I've not had a year's worth of experience.  My coworkers are awesome and concerned for each other as well as for our clients.
cons: We are moving into a new space and it's stressful to move.

pros:
Great place to work, very flexible schedules allow for a great work life balance. 
* 4 day work week is a fantastic option
* complete benefit package
* great work life balance
The organization really cares about employees and shows this by offering great work life balance as well as company sponsored appreciation events. Strong training and orientation program.
cons: You have to love working with a non profit as salaries are as expected and lower than the private sector.
